intro: Esterhazya campestris, commonly known as the field hawksbeard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers, which consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Esterhazya campestris is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is considered a hardy perennial in temperate climates.
